content: desperately seeking shallow single_crochet crescent shawl pattern version 2 0 © min g mng on ravelry rev sept 1 2014 materials  850 to 900 yd fingering weight yarn  4 5 mm and 4 0 mm crochet hook  yarn needle to weave in yarn ends  stitch markers stitch abbreviations u s crochet terms other abbreviations chain = chain flo = front loop only double_crochet= double_crochet skip = skip decrease = double_crochet two together st = stitch esc = extended single_crochet tch = turning chain fsc = foundation single_crochet half_double_crochet= half_double_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch tc = triple crochet notes  gauge and exact stitch counts are not important for this shawl design the border is very forgiving if you do more or fewer row in the body fudge a couple stitches if needed on any row  stitch markers help to keep the top edge neat after the ch2 & turn on the single_crochet row place a marker in the first single_crochet in the next row this shows the last single_crochet to stitch into at the end of the next row  at each single_crochet row end ch2 does not count as stitch do not stitch into this ch2 tch on the next row this gives more flexibility to the top edge of the shawl  at each esc half_double_crochet and double_crochet row end ch3 or ch4 as indicated counts as a stitch stitch into this ch3 or ch4 tch on the next row  on single_crochet increase row if the number of stitches does not work out exactly even only do the last 2sc increase if there are 4 or more stitches remaining in the previous row after the increase if there are less than 4 stitches remaining in the previous row after the increase omit the last 2sc increase  on the lace row fudge a stitch or two if needed ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
